title: 112_s1760
content:
The Act is titled the "Pill Mill Crackdown Act of 2011" and includes definitions for various terms. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to define "pill mill" as a facility that improperly prescribes controlled substances and "operator of a pill mill" as individuals associated with such facilities. SEC. 3. PENALTIES FOR OPERATION OF A PILL MILL: Amends the Controlled Substances Act to impose harsher penalties on operators of pill mills for distributing controlled substances in schedule II or III. Imprisonment term is doubled, fines are tripled, or both may apply.

SEC. 4. DISTRIBUTION TO PERSONS UNDER AGE TWENTY-ONE. SEC. 4. DISTRIBUTION TO PERSONS UNDER AGE TWENTY-ONE.

Amends the Controlled Substances Act to increase penalties for pill mill operators distributing to persons under age twenty-one. Offenders face triple the penalties in subsections (a) and (b). The sense of Congress is that certain offenses under the Controlled Substances Act lead to property forfeiture to the United States. Forfeited property can be used for the operations of the Office of National Drug Control Policy. Additionally, proceeds from forfeited property related to specific offenses will fund programs under the Public Health Service Act. Transfer between schedules of certain substances is also addressed. Schedule II of the Controlled Substances Act is amended to include limited quantities of certain narcotic drugs. Schedule III is also amended accordingly. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to include limited quantities of narcotic drugs in Schedule II and III. Amendments involve specific dosage limits for dihydrocodeinone with different combinations of ingredients.
